title: High-Resolution Sustain Pedal Depth Estimation from Piano Audio Across Room Acoustics
author: Kun Fang (McGill University), Hanwen Zhang (McGill University), Ziyu Wang (New York University), Ichiro Fujinaga (McGill University), ...
relevance_why: This paper's approach to continuous pedal depth estimation could inform Haohe Liu's work on audio processing techniques, particularly in controlling audio features for generative tasks in music.
background: This research focuses on estimating the sustain pedal depth in piano performances by analyzing audio recordings, providing a continuous range of depth rather than a binary on/off state.
contribution: This paper introduces a Transformer-based model for continuous sustain pedal depth estimation to solve the problem of binary pedal detection, achieving better performance in capturing expressive nuances of piano playing.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models primarily addressed pedal detection as a binary classification task, focusing on on/off states which miss the subtleties of continuous depth.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes a Transformer architecture to effectively predict a range of pedal depths, addressing limitations of binary-only approaches.

key_innovation: The integration of Transformer encoders for modeling continuous departal depth, allowing for nuanced analysis and representation of piano performances.
real_world_impact: Improves the fidelity of piano transcription and performance analysis, potentially influencing educational tools and performance technologies that rely on expressive pedaling.
limitations: Models struggle to generalize across various acoustic environments and exhibit bias towards reverberation effects.

new_terms.Transformer: **Transformer** is a deep learning model architecture primarily used for processing sequences of data, utilizing self-attention mechanisms to capture dependencies regardless of distance.
